parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. While the post doesn't explicitly name a candidate, it clearly refers to the author, Sebastian Tiberiu Pop, who is identified as a future deputy and is running for a public office. This directly relates to the upcoming parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook post, targeting a wide audience, not a private communication. The use of hashtags and the call for public opinion further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The post proposes a legislative initiative aimed at improving the quality of public leadership and increasing public trust in politics. While presented as a general improvement, the underlying objective is to enhance the author's image as a responsible and competent candidate, indirectly influencing voters' choices in the upcoming elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. Although the post discusses a relevant political issue, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic content. It's primarily a promotional piece advocating for a specific policy proposal by the candidate himself.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post presents itself as a personal opinion, it's clearly framed within an electoral context, aiming to promote the candidate's image and platform. The call to action ("Ați susține-o?") directly solicits electoral support.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>567876142503416</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post by Sebastian Tiberiu Pop, promoting his legislative proposal for mandatory psychological evaluations of public office candidates, constitutes electoral propaganda.  While the proposal itself is a matter of public interest, the post's context and framing clearly aim to influence voters' perception of the candidate.  The post is published during the electoral campaign period, directly relates to the candidate's political aspirations, targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and explicitly seeks public support for the proposal, which directly benefits the candidate's image and electability.  The lack of journalistic objectivity and the clear intention to garner electoral support outweigh any potential argument for it being merely a statement of personal opinion or a piece of citizen journalism.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Sebastian Tiberiu Pop</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 567876142503416) care promovează o inițiativă legislativă a candidatului, prezentându-se ca viitor deputat și solicitând susținerea publicului pentru aceasta.  Postarea, deși abordează un subiect de interes public, este clar o formă de propagandă electorală, având ca efect electoral consolidarea imaginii candidatului și influențarea votului în favoarea sa.  Utilizarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook, adresarea către un public larg și solicitarea directă de susținere ("Ați susține-o?") demonstrează intenția clară de a influența alegerile.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
